TopicTitle: How often do you play KSP?

Articles.Content:
(Sorry if a thread like this already exists)

 

Greetings KSP community, Something I decided to ask, how often do you play KSP? I myself play once every few days, I'd like to play it more but it's a bit laggy and crashy, probably due to all the mods I have installed. I also play in Career mode, which means I'm limited in the stuff I do by funds. How often do you play KSP and what are your reasons for playing it so often/not playing it that much?

 

-Dolphin.

Edited March 12, 2016 by DolphinDude3

It varies for me.  Sometimes every day for quite a while, but mostly each day for several days then a day or few off.  Occasionally I leave it for a couple of weeks or so, but not very often.

Currently just 'ticking over' waiting for 1.1 so playing a bit less, but not very seriously.

I play when I have the time and feel for it.

Usually a couple of hours each week, plus a bit more reading, thinking and planning which can be done when away from my computer (like on the metro).
I just started playing again after 2 months so you know. Before I took my break I played daily for hours at a time.

I usually manage to squeeze in a little KSP every weekend, but if my schedule weren't booked all week it would be daily.  KSP has all my free time, that just happens to be a very small, confined time.

Play pretty much everyday. Not actually working on anything other than trying out various mods and building ships. Waiting for 1.1 before I do my hopeful OPM grand tour

Edited March 13, 2016 by PanzerAce
not as often as i'd like - my old gaming rig isn't doing well with KSP or some other games, and needs replacing. probably would get a launch in most nights, if I could
Pretty much daily... unless reality gets in the way.
Daily... Except when I am away fro work. so in reality I miss 1-2 nights a week.

Periodically. I take brakes for months when I'm occupied with other games, or even real-life. But when I'm on, I'm on every day.

Though I like to browse this forum even when not actually playing. The community is lovely, and I'll never get bored with pictures of what everyone builds.
During the week I play on a daily basis, on the weekends, however, I go socialize with my friends - so no time for that nerdy stuff..

at one point.....well, let's just say I setup a web server on my KSP machine so I could signal it to launch KSP from my mobile when I got into wifi range, so by the time i'd got in, made tea and got to my machine, KSP would be all ready.  

These days not so much, actually been quite a couple months since I last played; I'm resting up for 1.1 and also I'd got rather fed up with the performance issues (and this annoyance called RL keeps getting in the way).  Hoping to get back into more regular playing once 1.1 comes out.
Only the wife could give an honest answer to that! Maybe the question should be "How often do you NOT play KSP?"

Generally daily, however I have had times when I've had enough or just don't want to play so I will go without for a week or so before I come crawling back.  I generally work in sandbox and jump around to different crafts with many different purposes, but I'll try to start a career and if I get past the initial grindfest, I keep it going till I'm waiting years for something to allign or arrive.
Since I got it on January 1st, every day. Almost.

As stated in another post, due to health issues, NOT MUCH...

 

However... that is starting to change... I changed my rank... no disabled something or other (so it would fit on one line) and adjusted my chair so the bad leg with the crappy knee and hip doesn't hurt too much...

and I started playing again today... not much... but either the re-entry heat is worse... or I seriously suck at building re-entry vehicles.....

Every day. Once I've finished my day job, picked up the Granddaughter from school and got her fed, watered and in bed, done a few jobs for the wife (sweeteners) the laptop goes on. I used to play games such as Assetto Corsa, rFactor etc. where pausing it when somebody needed me wasn't an option, however with KSP there is no rush so pressing the ESC key doesn't hurt

I probably play it too much as I'm a student and really should be studying harder (to become a coder). That said, I need to take a break every now and then and a good game usually fits the bill.

I've also only had the game a short time and it's still got that new game smell to it.

I play KSP several times a week between other games and intrests.

Fallout 4 and Xcom 2 occupied my time for a short while, but then back to KSP. I don't play as much as I used to a couple years ago, but I always go back.
